metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1853 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
chrony before 1.31.1 does not properly protect state variables in authenticated symmetric NTP associations, which allows remote attackers with knowledge of NTP peering to cause a denial of service (inability to synchronize) via random timestamps in crafted NTP data packets. Miroslav Lichvár discovered a head-based buffer overflow in chrony. A remote attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1853` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chrony - 2.1.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chrony package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
